sentences.en: But that does not mean transatlantic co - operation is a sham.
sentences.cn: 但这也不意味着大西洋联盟是佯装合作.

sentences.en: Even in straight transatlantic terms, the story is one of differences suppressed.
sentences.cn: 甚至是在直接的跨洋问题上, 搁置争议也是一例.

sentences.en: First transatlantic radio by Guglielmo Marconi.
sentences.cn: 古格列尔莫.马可尼首次跨洋传输无线电.

sentences.en: In 1936 Germany Began regular transatlantic airship passenger service.
sentences.cn: 1936年德国用飞船创办横越大西洋的定期客运业务.

sentences.en: Jumbo jets somehow lack the glamour of the transatlantic liner.
sentences.cn: 大型喷气式飞机不像橫渡大西洋的客轮那么引人注目.
许多跨大西洋的航班在那里着陆。

sentences.en: Since they were still Englishmen, there was no need to apologize for their transatlantic enthusiasms.
sentences.cn: 他们既然还是英国人, 热中于大西洋彼岸就不足为奇了.

sentences.en: The 66 - pound free luggage allowance is granted by the transatlantic airlines.
sentences.cn: 这家飞越大西洋航空公司准许每位旅客免费托运66磅行李.

sentences.en: The transatlantic alliance has survived the end of the cold war.
sentences.cn: 冷战结束后,大西洋两岸的跨洋合作仍然得以延续.

sentences.en: The transatlantic journey from New York was shortest when terminated in the United Kingdom.
sentences.cn: 横渡大西洋的航线,以自纽约至英伦的航程为最短.

sentences.en: The transatlantic liner forged ahead through the waves.
sentences.cn: 横渡大西洋的客轮破浪前进.

sentences.en: The Transatlantic Relationship after the EU - Enlargement: Turn Left, Turn Right?
sentences.cn: 欧洲联盟扩大后之大西洋关系: 向左走, 向右走?

sentences.en: THE transatlantic trade in political tactics has not always been one - way .
sentences.cn: 政治策略的两岸交易不总是 单向 的.
他们是我们在大西洋彼岸的朋友.

sentences.en: to speak with a transatlantic accent
sentences.cn: 说话带大西洋对岸的口音

words.tran_cn: 大西洋彼岸的，横渡大西洋的；美国的

trans.tran_cn: 大西洋彼岸的，横跨大西洋的，美国的
